parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: Remember device status after power failure
parameter.description:
Define how will the Plug react after the power supply is back on.
Default setting: 1
Available settings:
0 - Wall Plug does not memorize its state after a power failure. Connected device will be off after the power supply is reconnected.

parameter.name: config_39_2
parameter.label: 39: Alarm duration
parameter.description: Wall Plug's alarm mode duration. If a device sending an alarm frame through the Z-Wave network sets alarm duration as well, this parameter's settings are ignored.Default setting: 600 (seconds).Available settings: 1 - 65535 (seconds)

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Immediate power report
parameter.description: Parameter defines by how much power load must change, in percents, to be reported to the main controller, with the highest priority in the Z-Wave network. By default, Fibaro Wall Plug immediately sends power report if the power load changes by 80%.

parameter.name: config_42_1
parameter.label: 42: Standard power load report
parameter.description: Parameter defines by how much power load must change, in percents, to be reported to the main controller. By default, Fibaro Wall Plug sends power report if the power load changes by 15%. By default such changes in power load may be reported up to 5 times

parameter.name: config_43_1
parameter.label: 43: Power reporting frequency
parameter.description:
This parameter defines how frequently standard power reports (parameter 42) will be sent. By default Wall Plug sends up to 5 reports each 30 seconds, provided the power load changes by 15%.
Default seting: 30 (s)
Available settings: 1 - 254

parameter.name: config_45_1
parameter.label: 45: Reporting Changes in energy consumed by controlled devices
parameter.description:
Defines the required change in power to generate an unsolicited power report.
New, reported energy value is calculated based on last reported value. Default setting: 10 (0,1 kWh).
Available settings: 1 - 254 (0,01kWh - 2,54kWh).

parameter.name: config_47_2
parameter.label: 47: Time Period between reports on power and energy consumption
parameter.description: Parameter defines time period between reports sent when changes in power load have not been recorded. By default, if power load changes have not been recorded, reports are sent every hour. Default setting: 3 600 (s)Available settings: 1 - 65534 (s)

parameter.name: config_49_1
parameter.label: 49: Metering energy consumed by the Wall Plug itself.
parameter.description:
This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the Wall Plug itself.
Results are being added to energy consumed by controlled device.
Default setting: INACTIVE

parameter.name: config_50_2
parameter.label: 50: DOWN value
parameter.description:
Lower power threshold, used in parameter 52.
Default setting: 300 (30 W)
Available settings: 0 - 25 000 (0,0W - 2 500W)
DOWN value cannot be higher than a value specified in parameter 51.

parameter.name: config_51_2
parameter.label: 51: UP value
parameter.description:
Upper power threshold, used in parameter 52.
Default setting: 500 (50 W)
Available settings: 0 - 25 000 (0,0W - 2 500W)
UP value cannot be lower than a value specified in parameter 510

parameter.name: config_52_1
parameter.label: 52: Action in case defined power values exceeded
parameter.description:
Parameter defines the way 2nd association group devices are controlled, depending on the current power load.
Values are defined in parameters 50 and 51.
Available settings:
0 - function inactive
1 - turn the associated devices on

parameter.name: config_60_2
parameter.label: 60: Power load to make red ring flash violet
parameter.description:
Function is active only when parameter 61 is set to 0 or 1.
Default setting: 25 000 (2 500W)
Available settings: 1 000 - 32 000 (100W - 3200W).

parameter.name: config_61_1
parameter.label: 61: LED color when device is on

LED will use continuous color depending on power
